Package com.group7.krisefikser.controller

Class AuthController

java.lang.Object
com.group7.krisefikser.controller.AuthController
@RestController @RequestMapping("/api/auth") public class AuthController extends Object
Controller class for handling authentication requests. This class provides endpoints for user registration and login.

  • Method Details

    • registerUser

      @PostMapping("/register") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<AuthResponse> registerUser(@Valid @RequestBody @Valid RegisterRequest request)
      Endpoint for user registration. This method handles the registration of a new user. It accepts a RegisterRequest object containing user details.
      Parameters:
      request - the registration request containing user details
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing the authentication response

    • loginUser

      @PostMapping("/login") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<AuthResponse> loginUser(@Valid @RequestBody @Valid LoginRequest request, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
      Endpoint for user login. This method handles the login of an existing user. It accepts a LoginRequest object containing user credentials.
      Parameters:
      request - the login request containing user credentials
      response - the HTTP response object
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing the authentication response

    • verifyEmail

      @GetMapping("/verify-email") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<AuthResponse> verifyEmail(@Valid @RequestParam @Valid String token)
      Endpoint for email verification. This method handles the verification of a user's email. It accepts a token as a request parameter.
      Parameters:
      token - the verification token
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing the authentication response

    • getCurrentUserEmail

      @GetMapping("/me") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> getCurrentUserEmail()
      Endpoint for getting the current user's email. This method retrieves the email of the currently authenticated user.
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing the user's email or no content if not authenticated
